description.narrative: Local agricultural businesses including farmers, fishermen and livestock have increased productive capacities for high nutrition value food production

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)
United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 2.1 . Number of direct beneficiaries of wage employment: (disaggregated by gender: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.2 . Number of working days created (disaggregated by gender: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.3 Number of indirect beneficiaries from emergency jobs and other livelihoods in crisis or post-crisis settings (IDPs/Returnees, etc.) (IRRF 6.1.1.) 2.4 Number of livestok breeders supported with large and small ruminant breeding focusing on dairy production 2.5 Number of horticulture farmers supported to raise their production level to mitigate the food insecurity in their community and to create surpluses for animal fodder 2.6 Number of supported fishermen 2.7 Number of new jobs created under the project support

comment.narrative: The project is awaiting funds to be received in order to be able to start implementing activities
Not applicable as the activities were completed in 2020
Not applicable as the activities were completed in 2020

The output indicators are: 2.1: 953 direct beneficiaries of wage employment: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.2: 46,600 working days created: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.3: 5,718 indirect beneficiaries from emergency jobs and other livelihoods in crisis or post-crisis settings 2.4: 528 livestock breeders supported with large and small ruminant breeding focusing on dairy production 2.5: 210 horticulture farmers supported to raise their production level to mitigate the food insecurity in their community and to create surpluses for animal fodder 2.6: 215 supported fishermen 2.7: 4500 new jobs created under the project support

Q3: 2.1: 1,149 direct beneficiaries of wage employment: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.2: 78,186 working days created: women 30%: Youth 30%; IDPs/Returnees: 15%) 2.3: 10,245 indirect beneficiaries from emergency jobs and other livelihoods in crisis or post-crisis settings 2.4: 697 livestock breeders supported with large and small ruminant breeding focusing on dairy production 2.5: 212 horticulture farmers supported to raise their production level to mitigate the food insecurity in their community and to create surpluses for animal fodder 2.6: 240 supported fishermen 2.7: 10,245 new jobs created under the project support
